data.title: Great place for a vegan lunch or dinner.
data.text: Excellent choices, big portions and tasty combinations. I will be back again! The meaty sandwiches, the great salads and slaws are worth the price.

data.title: Delicious and unique vegan lunch
data.text: I was passing through Berkeley and planned to stop her for lunch after they were featured on vegnews Instagram. Such a good decision! I ordered the original grinder so I could try all the meats, the macaroni salad and a cannoli. Everything was just as good as I hoped it would be! Love the concept and hope this place sticks around!

data.title: Mindblowing Lunch!
data.text:
My husband and I were in town and had heard about The Butcher's Son. We were thrilled when we found out it was less than a mile from the David Bower Conference where we were attending CowCon. We snuck away for lunch and let's just say we were thrilled we did! My husband had the burger and I had the Mediterranean salad. Both were EXCELLENT! My meat eating husband said it was the best burger he'd had. I am a huge salad eater and am usually hungry after most salads so I was grateful this salad was big enough to fill me and last the afternoon.
Highly recommend!

data.title: If I lived in Berkeley, I would eat here all the time!
data.text: The Pulled "Pork" Sandwich with coleslaw and grilled onions is out-of-this-world. And the macaroni salad brought back fond memories of childhood dinners at our New York City neighborhood delicatessen. The Cherry Turnover and Cannoli were sublime. I was disappointed that they were all out of Chocolate Croissants. But vegan chocolate croissants are a great excuse to visit Berkeley again soon. I can't wait!

data.title: Love the Idea, not the Execution
data.text:
To be fair, I will most likely try this place again to determine whether or not my one visit was a fluke. However, that one visit was a bit of a let down. 

Let's be honest, there aren't a whole lot of vegan "butcher" shops around. The concept is definitely interesting and when my husband and I were walking by in Berkeley, we couldn't pass up the opportunity to try it out. 

Although we don't usually obsess about meat substitutes, fried mozzarella and croissants are not often on a vegan menu!

We both got seemingly the most amazing choice--meatball sub with fried mozzarella. The sandwich also comes with a side, I opted out for the lesser heart attack with a side of a house-made pickle while my hubby got the bacon macaroni salad (when in Rome, right?)

First, the good: the house-made pickle was my favorite part of the meal. It was tangy and crunchy and huge, just like a pickle should be. The macaroni salad with "bacon" was also pretty tasty.

Now on to the main meal: the meatball sub was a little weird and unbalanced. First of all, one of the best parts about meatball subs and meatballs in general is the delicious marinara that should be slathered all over it. Unfortunately, in the case of this sad substitute there was maybe a drop of marinara to be found. Then there were the meatballs themselves, they weren't bad exactly, but kind of tasted pretty bland and uneventful. There was not enough spice for the mass of whatever meat substitute they were using. The fried mozz was pretty inventive and definitely not bad, but for some reason it was a bit on the cold side which meant that a lot of leaked out and hardened. 

The space is pretty small and pretty crowded, so if you're going for lunch or dinner at a standard time, I would recommend taking your food to go. 

They also have some interesting looking desserts like cheesecakes and croissants--again not your typical vegan fare. 

I would go back to try out the desserts and even more sandwich options, but from my first experience it was all pretty meh. Also, the prices are obviously high (it's a vegan "butcher" after all), which would have been fine had the food been as good as it promised to be, but it just wasn't and it sucks to spend close to $15 per person for a sandwich that underwhelms.

data.title: Mind game with your taste buds
data.text: This place is 100% vegan and somehow they make everything and it plays games with you. Bacon donuts taste like bacon... But they are vegan. Everything is huge so you get your monies worth. I enjoyed everything I had. I really can't wait to go back again.

data.title: Exceptionally tasty sandwiches...absolutely delicious!!!
data.text:
I would seriously eat here at least twice per week, every week of the year, if I lived in San Francisco. The food is great. I am VERY impressed.

This small vegan deli makes excellent sandwiches, and I am not vegan or vegetarian. This is food that even a meat lover like me really loves big flavorful sandwiches. Their salads are good too.

I had the sandwich called "Grinder" which I can heartily recommend. The vegan "meat" was surprisingly meaty. My friend had a mozzarella and meatball sandwhich, which she loved too. It looked even better than mine!! The sandwiches are huge, and come with a side dish. I ordered "bacan noodle something" which was tasty too.

My mother who joined us for lunch, had a sandwhich she did not like at all. It was called Caprisse or something like that, and she thought it was bland and not worth ordering. So don't order that sandwhich, until they improve it.

The chocolate chip cookies are big and they have gooey, soft chocolate which I love. The only disadvantage for me is that they sprinkle a bit of salt on the cookies, which some people like because it enhances the flavor, but I am very sensitive to salt and don't want to taste salt in a dessert. 

Overall, I give this place a 10 out of 10. Great effort, friendly, with delicious food and pleasant atmosphere.

data.title: All-vegan menu with messy, delicious sandwiches
data.text: This is the vegan restaurant Berkeley has needed!  A casual, low-cost vegan sandwich can be had here for ~$11.  Order at the counter, and they call your name in a few minutes, for a freshly assembled sandwich. They are a deli, with a cold case stocked with meats & cheeses you can purchase by the pound.  Each sandwich gets one side: vinegary potato salad, pickles, macaroni salad, or mac salad with bacon.  Everything is vegan. We had the Hot Roast Beef sandwich on toasted slices of sourdough, mayo, mustard, lettuce, tomato, Swiss cheese, and the Philly Cheesesteak on a hoagie bun, correctly loaded down with sauteed sweet & hot peppers, onions, mushrooms, Swiss cheese. Both sandwiches had lots of gluten-based "meat" slices that came off a real deli meat slicer. The only downside is that the sandwiches are a tad greasy, because they fry up the meat on a grill, but that is why the taste is so amazing!  Cannot wait to try everything else on the menu: meatball sub, mozarella sticks, the chicken sandwiches, oh and all the bakery items: croissants, donuts, and yummy-looking pastries. Gets pretty busy around lunchtime, just be patient.  These sandwiches are well worth the wait.

data.title: FABULOUS DELI SANDWICHES!
data.text:
Whether you live in Berkeley or are just visiting, you MUST check this place out!

Yep, there will likely be a wait, and the chance of getting a table at the height of lunch/brunch might be slim but you've GOT  to try: the fried mozzarella and meatball sub, the hot roast beef  and the chicken B.L.A.T. ( chicken with bacon, lettuce tomato and avocado).  This place is a game-changer. These sandwiches ROCK. They are amazingly delicious.  It's been a long time since I've eaten meat but I've eaten here with omnivores who swore it was amazing.. And service is super - friendly. 

If you believe in the power of well-made, delicious  vegan food to save animals,  you MUST support this place and take your carnivorous friends there too.

There are often longish waits to put in your order and I'm hoping  they'll be able to speed things up.  Not easy, I know, but imo important for long term success. Maybe they need a system like HipCityVeg in Philly? Again, I want to emphasize how everyone working here was so nice; they are giving it all they have to keep up with the demand.  I love this place!

Thank you Butcher's Son for bringing fabulous veg food to Berkeley!!!
